systemic_patterns: Article 6 (german-moving-in-together) is fundamentally broken: all VocabCards and PhraseOfDay contain Italian words instead of German, the expressions table uses numbered placeholders, and the CTA has no props. This appears to be an incomplete template that was never properly filled with German content.

Four articles (1, 3, 11, and parts of 6) are missing import statements for their MDX components. The HTML converter handles this gracefully, but the MDX source files would fail to build in Astro without imports.

Article 1 (en-in-laws) uses IPA notation (ɪts soʊ naɪs tuː) for all pronunciations while every other article uses simplified Italian-friendly phonetic guides (lets go on a deit). IPA is unreadable for most Italian learners without linguistic training.
Article 1 uses a non-existent 'PhraseCard' component instead of the standard VocabCard or PhraseOfDay components. This is the only article with this pattern.
Three articles (1, 3, 11) are missing CTA components at the end. While not critical, this is inconsistent with the other 9 articles that include CTAs.

The 'è' vs 'e' confusion (Italian 'is' vs 'and') appears in two separate articles (5 and 11), suggesting a systematic AI generation error where the accent mark is incorrectly applied to the conjunction.
Articles promising '50+' items in their titles (articles 0 and 5) deliver roughly 15-28 items, which is a significant shortfall that may affect SEO credibility and user trust.

Article 9 (Portuguese compliments) has a PhraseOfDay that rendered as a VocabCard style with an empty word field in the HTML, suggesting a converter bug when the PhraseOfDay component uses a full sentence as its word value.
